(3)  A person under eighteen (18) years of age to purchase goods or services at the establishment. 
(4)  A person to work at the establishment as an employee who is under eighteen (18) years of age. 
(e)  Working at establishment which does not have valid adult entertainment business tax receipt. It shall be unlawful for any person to act as an employee of an adult entertainment establishment that he knows or should know does not hold a business tax receipt under this article, or which has a business tax receipt which is under suspension, has been revoked or cancelled, or has expired. 
(f)  Violations subject to criminal prosecution. Whoever violates any provision of this article may be prosecuted and punished as provided in section 1-15 and may be prosecuted through the city code enforcement board. 
(Ord. No. 24-2009, § 2, 6-9-09)  
Secs. 11-105—11-125. - Reserved.  
ARTICLE IV. - BUILDING CONTRACTORS[4] 
Footnotes: 
--- (4) --- 
Cross reference— Buildings and building regulations, Ch. 6; qualifications for obtaining building permits, § 6-58; certification of plumbers required, § 6-147; use of master journeyman's name prohibited, § 6-148; license required for gas installations, § 6-175(c); classification of electrical workers, § 6-203; swimming pool contractors qualifications, § 18-3. 
State Law reference— Contractors and contracting, F.S. ch. 489. 
 
DIVISION 1. - GENERALLY 
 
Sec. 11-126. - Definitions. 
The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this article, shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning: 
Board shall mean the City of Titusville Code Enforcement Board. 
Certificate of competency shall mean that instrument which is issued to an individual upon passage of a standard examination required by this article or required by the building official verifying the passage of the standard examination. 
Certificate of compliance shall mean that instrument which authorizes an individual, firm or corporation to engage in subcontracting in a category as specified in section 11-126, specialized contractor classifications. Entities which hold a certificate of compliance may subcontract work covered by the certificate of compliance from residential, building, general or owner contractors, but may not themselves subcontract any work to any other person except work covered by the certificate of compliance and then only to a person who also possesses a current certificate of compliance issued by the city for all work being subcontracted. A certificate of compliance does not qualify the holder to obtain permits for construction. 
Certificate of proficiency shall mean that instrument which is issued to an individual upon passage of a standard examination required by this article or required by the building official verifying the passage of the standard examination. 
Contracting shall mean engaging in business as a contractor. 
Contractor shall mean a person who in any capacity undertakes, or offers to undertake, or purports to have the capacity to undertake, or accepts an order or contract either on a fixed sum, cost plus a percentage, or a fixed fee, or any combination thereof, or for any other type of compensation, or submits a bid or does himself, or by others, to construct, alter, repair, add to, subtract from, improve, move, wreck or demolish any building or other structure, to excavate, or commence any project, development or improvement or do any other part thereof, including the erection of scaffolding, or other structures or works in connection therewith or the incorporation of labor or materials therein. Contractors include specialty contractors and contractors in the following categories: 
(1)  General contractors (Class I) are those whose services are unlimited. 
(2)  Building contractors (Class II) are those whose services are limited to construction of commercial buildings and single or multiple-dwelling residential buildings, neither to exceed three (3) stories in height, and accessory remodeling, repair or improvement of any size building if the services do not affect the structural members of the building. 
(3)  Residential building contractors (Class III) are those whose services are limited to construction remodeling, repair or improvement of one-, two- or three-family unit residences not exceeding two (2) stories in height and accessory use structures in connection therewith. 
(4)  Class A air conditioning contractor (HARV unlimited) means any person whose services are unlimited in the execution of contracts requiring the experience, knowledge and skill to perform the following: Install, maintain, repair, fabricate, alter, extend or design, when not prohibited by law, central air conditioning, refrigeration, heating and ventilating, including duct work in connection with a complete system only to the extent such duct work is performed by the contractor necessary to make complete an air distribution system, boiler and unfired pressure vessel systems, and all appurtenances, apparatus or equipment systems, and all appurtenances, apparatus or equipment used in connection therewith; also piping, insulation of pipes, vessels and ducts, pressure and process piping, pneumatic control piping, and installation of a condensate drain from an air conditioning unit to an existing safe waste or other approved disposal other than a direct connection to a sanitary system, all in such a manner as to comply with all plans, specifications, codes, laws and regulations applicable thereto. The scope of work for such contractor shall also include any excavation work incidental thereto, but shall not include any work such as liquefied petroleum or natural gas fuel lines within buildings, potable waterlines or connections thereto, sanitary sewer lines, swimming pool piping and filters, and electrical power wiring. 
(5)  Class B air conditioning contractor (HARV unlimited) means any person whose services are limited to twenty-five (25) tons cooling and five hundred thousand (500,000) btu heating (in any one (1) system) in the execution of contracts requiring the experience, knowledge and skill to perform the following: Install, maintain and repair, fabricate, alter, extend or design when not prohibited by law, central air conditioning, refrigeration, heating and ventilation, including duct work in connection with a complete system only to the extent such duct work is performed by the contractor necessary to make complete an air distribution system being installed under this classification; also piping, insulation of pipes, vessels and ducts, and installation of a condensate drain from any air conditioning unit to an existing safe waste or other approved manner as to comply with all plans, specifications, codes, laws and regulations applicable thereto. 
(6)  Class C air conditioning contractor (HARV refrigeration) means any person whose business is limited to the servicing of air conditioning, heating or refrigeration systems, including duct alterations in connection with those systems they are servicing. Service is herein defined as maintenance service and replacement of certain minor components of an air conditioning/refrigeration system of up to twenty-five (25) tons and a heating system not to exceed two hundred thousand (200,000) btu straight heating. Minor components shall include sections of refrigeration tubing and recharging, solenoid and relays, thermostats, belts, blower motors and minor alterations of duct systems not to exceed ten (10) percent of the total duct system. Service work shall not include repairs. Repairs are herein defined as the replacement of major component items such as blower assemblies, condensation units, compressors, compressor motors and major alterations to duct systems. Exception: No examination, registration or certification is required under this part for the sales, service or installation of package heating or air conditioning units (window-type units) with no ducts or remote controls (maximum of three (3) tons, thirty-six thousand (36,000) btu in capacity). 
(7)  Mechanical contractor (HARV mechanical) means any person whose services are unlimited in the execution of contracts requiring the knowledge, experience and skill to perform the following: Install, maintain, repair, fabricate, alter, extend or design, when not prohibited by law, central air conditioning, refrigeration, heating and ventilating including duct work in connection with a complete system only to the extent such duct work is performed by the contractor necessary to make complete an air distribution system, boiler and unfired pressure vessel systems, lift station equipment and piping and all appurtenances, apparatus or equipment used in connection therewith; also piping, gasoline tanks and pump installations and piping for same, air piping, vacuum line piping, oxygen lines, nitrous oxide piping, ink and chemical lines, fuel transmission lines and installation of existing safe waste or other approved disposal other than a direct connection to a sanitary system, all in such a manner as to comply with all plans, specifications, codes, laws, and regulations applicable thereto. The scope of work for such contractor shall also include any excavation work incidental thereto, but shall not include any work such as liquefied petroleum or natural gas fuel lines within buildings, potable waterlines or connections thereto, sanitary sewer lines, swimming pool piping and filters and electrical power wiring. 
(8)  Master electrician shall mean a person who possesses the necessary qualifications, training and technical knowledge to plan, layout and supervise the installation of electrical wiring, apparatus or equipment for light, heat or power, and who is qualified under the provisions of this article. 
(9)  Journeyman electrician shall mean a person who possesses the necessary qualifications, training and technical knowledge to install electrical wiring, apparatus or equipment for light, heat or power and who is qualified under the terms and provisions of this article. He shall be capable of doing electrical work according to the plans and specifications furnished to him and in accordance with the rules and regulations governing wiring installations within the city's jurisdiction. 
(10)  Master plumber shall mean a person who possesses the necessary qualifications, training and technical knowledge to plan, layout and supervise the installation of plumbing equipment, apparatus or equipment or other related work according to the standards of the Standard Plumbing Code. 
(11)  Journeyman plumber shall mean a person who possesses the necessary qualifications, training and technical knowledge to install plumbing fixtures and apparatus or equipment, who is qualified under the terms and provisions of this article. He shall be capable of doing plumbing work according to the plans and specifications furnished to him and in accordance with the rules and regulations governing plumbing installations within the city. 
(12)  Commercial pool contractor or "Class A" pool contractor means any person whose scope of work involves but is not limited to the construction, repair, water treatment and servicing of all swimming pools, both public or private or otherwise, and used for therapy, swimming or other use. This work shall include but not be limited to layout, excavation, operation of construction pumps for dewatering purposes, steelwork, installation of light niches, pouring of floors, guniting, fiberglassing, installation of tile and coping, installation of all perimeter and filter piping, installation of all filter equipment and chemical feeders of any type, plastering of the interior, pouring of decks, construction of equipment rooms or housing for pool equipment, and the installation of package pool heaters. However, the scope of work of such contractor shall not include direct connections to a sanitary sewer system or to potable water lines. 
(13)  Sheet metal contractor means one whose services are unlimited in the sheet metal trade and who has the experience, knowledge and skill necessary for the manufacture, fabrication, assembling, handling, erection, installation, dismantling, conditioning, adjustment, alteration, repair, servicing and design, when not prohibited by law, or ferrous or nonferrous metal work of U.S. No. 10 gauge or its equivalent or lighter gauge and other materials used in lieu thereof; and air handling systems including the setting of air handling equipment and reinforcement of the same and including the balancing of air handling systems. 
(14)  Roofing contractor means one whose services are unlimited in the roofing trade and who has the experience, knowledge and skill to install, maintain, repair, alter, extend or design when not prohibited by law, and use materials and items used in the installation, maintenance, extension and alteration of all kinds of roofing and waterproofing, all in such manner as to comply with all plans, specifications, codes, laws and regulations applicable thereto. 
(15)  Residential pool contractor or "Class B" pool contractor means any person whose scope of work involves but is not limited to the construction, repair, water treatment and servicing of all residential swimming pools used for therapy, swimming or other use. This work shall include but not be limited to layout, excavation, operation of construction pumps for dewatering purposes, steelwork, installation of light niches, pouring of floors, guniting, fiberglassing, installation of tile and coping, installation of all perimeter and filter piping, installation of all filter equipment and chemical feeders of any type, plastering of the interior, pouring of decks, installation of housing for pool equipment and the installation of package pool heaters. However, the scope of work of such contractor shall not include direct connections to a sanitary sewer system or to potable water lines. 
(16)  Swimming pool servicing contractor or "Class C" pool contractors are those contractors whose scope of work involves the servicing, repair, water treatment and maintenance of all swimming pools, both public and private. They shall be permitted to make any necessary piping and repairs, to replace and repair all existing equipment, or to install new additional equipment as necessary. Their scope of work shall include the reinstallation of tile and coping; repair and replacing of all piping, filter equipment, and chemical feeders of any type; replastering; repouring of decks; and the reinstalling or addition of pool heaters. 
Engage in business shall mean doing a trade of any owner or any tenant of land, water or of a building or any part thereof, or for any person in possession of or in charge of the same or any part thereof, or entering into a contract with such owner, tenant or person for the doing of a trade. 
Firm shall include a sole proprietorship, partnership, association, corporation, agency or any other type of business organization. 
Owner shall mean any person who owns property either individually, jointly or by an estate by the entirety with another person. When the provisions of this article provide for the issuance of a building permit to an owner, and the title to the property upon which the building permit is issued shall be held other than individually but within the limitations of this definition, such other person holding title together with the applicant shall join in the application for such permit. Ownership in this definition shall be fee simple ownership and nothing herein contained shall require a mortgagee or other lien holder to join in such application. 
Specialty contractor shall mean a contractor whose operations consist of the performances of construction work requiring special skills, and whose principal contracting business involves the use of specialized building trades and crafts. The following classifications shall show proof of at least one (1) year's experience, except as otherwise stated herein, in their selected field of construction and meet the requirements as hereinafter provided. Specialty contractors shall be classified as, but not limited to, one (1) of the following crafts: 
(1)  Aluminum: Qualified to fabricate, erect and install screen enclosures with metal-supporting members, in whole or part self-supporting and shall include any work dealing with the use of aluminum, piece work or any work related thereto. The scope of the work shall include footings and slabs, on grade only, in connection with the overall project. 
(2)  Carpentry: Qualified to build, install or repair nonstructural wooden items such as cabinets, trim, doors, windows, window and door frames, molding or any other wooden item or member which is not a structural part of the building or structure. Structural work may be performed if first an outstanding permit for such work is obtained by contractor holding proper certificate of competency. Nonstructural part of the building or structure may include formwork for concrete placement. 
(3)  Communications towers: Qualified to fabricate and erect communications towers in accordance with approved engineering drawings in such a manner as to comply with all applicable codes, laws and industry standards. Permits will be required in all cases for towers in excess of thirty-five (35) feet, height to be measured from grade as defined in chapter II of the Standard Building Code. 
(4)  Concrete and masonry: Qualified to construct forms and framework for the casting and shaping of concrete, including but not limited to columns, beams, decks and window frames, to place and erect reinforcing steel and miscellaneous embedded steel and to pour, place and finish concrete, including terrazzo. This category shall include the cutting and laying of all masonry items including, but not limited to brick, block, clay products, rough and cut stone, structural glass, decorative block and veneer block all installed in accordance with applicable codes and industry recommendations and standards. 
(5)  Elevators: See F.S. ch. 399 as defined therein. 
(6)  Fencing: Qualified to fabricate, assemble, erect and install fences of masonry, chain link, concrete, wood and other fence materials in such manner that an acceptable fence can be erected, complying with applicable regulations, including zoning regulations. 
(7)  Fire sprinkler systems: Applicant must show proof of certification by state fire marshal's office as a prerequisite to application submittal. Qualified to install, maintain, repair, alter or extend all piping for fire sprinkler systems, including the connection to the water service outlet provided solely for fire sprinkler systems. Installation of a fire sprinkler in laundry and waste chutes, or garbage rooms, shall not constitute a system which would permit the installation of standpipes in conjunction therewith. The system must be approved and accepted by the building department and the fire department. 
(8)  Gas fitter (bottled or liquefied petroleum gas): Such competency shall have as a prerequisite that the individual hold a certificate from the state fire marshal's office prior to submittal of application. Applicant shall be qualified to install, maintain, repair, alter or extend fuel gas piping or appliances involving bottled or liquefied petroleum gas. 
(9)  Gas fitter (natural gas): Qualified to install, maintain, repair, alter or extend fuel gas piping or appliances involving natural gas. 
(10)  House moving and demolition: Limited to the loading, moving and unloading of structures and qualified to demolish frame or block structures not exceeding two (2) stories in height. Anything to be demolished over two (2) stories must show proof of H.H. Block examination passage. 
(11)  Marine construction: Qualified as a Class I or II building contractor as defined by state and local regulations. 
(12)  Mobile homes: Qualified to install mobile homes to meet the state standards or any other applicable federal laws. This classification shall include no work for which state registration or for which an examination is required as stated in previous sections of this article, but shall include the installation of slab, tiedowns, etc. Permits may be obtained for installation by owners or agents of the mobile home site. 
(13)  Painting and waterproofing: Qualified to clean, caulk and size surfaces in preparation for and to apply paint and related liquid or viscous products thereon by brush, roller or spray methods in such a manner that under an agreed specification, satisfactory painting and waterproofing can be accomplished. 
(14)  Paving: Qualified to construct roads, airport runways and aprons, parking lots, sidewalks, curbs and gutters, property line walls, storm drainage facilities and to perform the excavating, clearing and grading incidental thereto. 
(15)  Sign erection: Qualified to paint or otherwise apply or erect outside displays of character, letters, illustrations or ornamentations. The work of sign contractor shall include the installation of panels, facing, frame, structure, movable or fixed, freestanding or attached to a building or other structure which is to be used for sign purposes or erection. Any electrical work involved must be accomplished by a licensed electrician. 
(16)  Solar contractor: A person who possesses the requisite qualifications, training and technical knowledge and who is qualified in accordance with this article: 
a.  Class A. Qualified to fabricate, extend, alter and install any and all solar components and appurtenances thereto. This would include water, other known volatile liquids and gases being utilized as the vehicle for thermal transfer and would not be limited to a heating classification. Having a minimum of two (2) years' experience in plumbing or mechanical with an additional one (1) year's experience in supervisory capacity; however, applicant may substitute a maximum of one-third required time in a related electric or structural field. 
b.  Class B. Qualified to utilize only water as a thermal transfer medium. Limited to the thermal transfer components and storage tank installation. Having a minimum of two (2) years' experience in plumbing or mechanical with a portion of these two (2) years, not to exceed fifty (50) percent, in an electrical or structural field. A minimum of one (1) year's experience in supervisory capacity in mechanical or plumbing is required. 
c.  Class C. Qualified to install solar components and storage tanks which use nonpotable supplies. Limited to the installation of solar components on or at grade level and minor repairs and system alterations without increased structural and system alterations without increased structural loading on other existing systems. Having a minimum of two (2) years' experience in plumbing or mechanical fields. No supervisory experience is required. 
(17)  Tile, terrazzo and marble: Qualified to mix, place, screed, grind, polish and finish terrazzo applied to surfaces erected and provided by others. Also qualified to erect, attach, apply and embed tile or concrete, clay or any other materials, none of which exceeds three-fourths inch in thickness to floors or walls and shall include tile veneer not exceeding three-fourths inch thickness to the exterior of buildings. 
(18)  Underground fuel tank: Qualified to install underground storage tanks concrete or other surfaces and piping as required to facilitate tanks' use wherein it is not governed or limited by other ordinances or state laws. Shall also include the placement of equipment, ballasting, tiedowns, earth backfill. Electrical work shall be a part of the project contract and such work shall be performed by a properly licensed electrical contractor. 
(19)  Underground utilities: Qualified to excavate, construct, install, repair or alter pipelines, such as water and gas transmission and distribution lines, storm and sanitary sewerage lines, force main outfalls, and pumping facilities incidental to the collection or installation of pipeline products including the equipment and piping installation and placing within a structure which is constructed for the purpose of pumping or processing such pipeline products. An underground utilities contractor may construct or install junction boxes, manholes, inlets, valves and similar components, in such a manner as to comply with all plans, specifications, codes, laws and regulations applicable. The work of the underground utilities contractor shall be considered to stop at a point not more than five (5) feet from the intersection of right-of-way and private property. The scope of work of such a contractor does not include the installation of chilled water lines or related work incidental thereto. Passage of an H. H. Block examination in this category is a prerequisite to issuance of the competency card. 
Specialized contractor shall mean a contractor whose operations consist of the performance of a trade which requires technical knowledge and skills gained through experience. Specialized contractors are issued a certificate of compliance in accordance with these definitions and section 11-195. Specialized contractor classifications include, but are not limited to, the following defined categories: 
(1)  Alarm installers: Qualified to install low voltage wiring systems for fire or security alarm systems. System voltage is limited to fifty (50) volts AC/DC. No direct wiring into existing load centers or junction boxes is authorized. 
(2)  Carpeting and vinyl installation: Qualified to install semipermanent floor coverings of fabric, vinyl, linoleum or wood, not including ceramic tile or stone work. 
(3)  Drywall: Qualified to install gypsum drywall products to studs, joists and suspended ceiling channels and to fabricate and install metal accessories and all necessary trim in connection therewith including metal studs, runners, hangers, channels, drywall metal suspensions accessories, and prefabricated ceiling materials, provided that any plaster work or troweled material, application of block or wood partitions shall not be a part of metal stud framing. 
(4)  Excavating and grading: Qualified to make excavations, to obtain or remove materials such as rock, gravel or sand, to construct or excavate canals, lakes, levees, roadways, including land cleaning, filling, and grading. An excavating and grading specialized contractor may do the work of a land clearing and grubbing contractor, including landscaping. 
(5)  Glass and glazing: Qualified to install and attach windows of any type, fixed or movable, and swinging or building walls or columns holding or supporting mullions or horizontal bars which in turn are attached to building walls or columns erected by others, including the cutting and installation of glass and shall also include metal accessories and prefabricated glass, metal or plastic curtain walls or panels and tinting. The scope of work shall include the fabrication and installation of garage and industrial doors and shower and tub enclosure doors and metal facias, storefront awnings or canopies. 
(6)  Insulation and acoustic tile: Qualified to fabricate, install and apply thermal acoustic or fire-retardant acoustic material to walls, floors, ceilings or within such walls, floors or ceiling, by mechanical or adhesive method in such a manner to comply with applicable codes and industry recommendations and standards. 
(7)  Landscaping: Qualified to perform the placement of sod, shrubbery, bushes, trees and ornamental plantings and independent ornamental structures, e.g. fountains, birdbaths, decorative statuary. Any plumbing connections shall be made by a licensed master plumber. Placement of recirculating and/or single direction fountains shall fall under the scope of work of a lawn sprinkling specialized contractor, or master plumber contractor (if potable water is utilized). 
(8)  Lathing and plastering: Qualified to apply and affix wood, gypsum or metal lath or any other product prepared or manufactured, including the placing of metal studs and runners to which lath is to be applied, to provide hangers, channels and other mechanical suspension work for the support of lath or acoustical tile or other prefabricated ceiling materials, including the channel iron work for the support of metal or other fire-resistive lath on wall, ceilings or soffits, or for solid plaster partitions, and to coat surfaces with a mixture of sand or other aggregate, gypsum, plastering, Portland cement or quicklime and water or any combination of such materials as to create a permanent surface coating and which coatings are usually applied with a plasterer's trowel or by pneumatic pressure on any surface which offers a mechanical key for the support of such coating or to which the coating will adhere by suction. The scope of work shall not include the erection of wood stud or masonry walls. Such contractor may perform the work of a drywall contractor. 
(9)  Lawnsprinkler: Qualified to install irrigation systems for residential, commercial, and agricultural lawns and gardens. Classification does not include connections to potable water, which must be accomplished by a master plumber, nor well drilling which is a separate category. 
(10)  Painting/waterproofing/sandblasting: Qualified to clean, sandblast, pressure clean, caulk and size surfaces in preparation for and to apply paint and related liquid or viscous products thereon by brush, roller or spray methods in such a manner that under an agreed specification, satisfactory painting and waterproofing can be accomplished. 
(11)  Property management and maintenance: Qualified to make minor, nonstructural repairs such as to repair nonbearing frames, repair floors, doors and locks, caulk and make necessary painting repairs, patch and stucco repairs, provided, however, that the scope of the work shall not include plumbing, electrical, mechanical, roofing, or structural work of any kind. 
(12)  Sewer cleaner: To remove the cleanout plug for the purpose of cleaning and/or removal of blockage causing stoppage in building drains and sewers. Not included within the definition of sewer cleaning is work included with the definition of plumbing as defined in section 6-141. 
(13)  Tile, terrazzo and marble: Qualified to mix, place, screed, grind, polish and finish terrazzo, tile or marble applied to surfaces erected and provided by others. Also qualified to erect, attach, apply and embed tile or concrete, clay or any other materials to floors or walls and shall include tile veneer not exceeding three-fourths-inch thickness to the exterior of buildings. 
(14)  Tree removal/tree surgeon: Qualified to prune, trim, cut down, and transplant trees, remove tree root systems and stumps, cable, fill cavities, brace and support damaged trees, and treat trees for various bacteriological or fungal diseases, as long as such treatment does not require the use of controlled toxic substances. Permits for tree removal may be issued to persons in this category. 
(15)  Well drilling: Qualified to drill water supply or drainage wells, install and maintain and repair pumps incidental to a private swimming pool, not to include pumps, filters and chlorinators incidental to such pools. A well-drilling specialized contractor may install lawn sprinkler systems and make connection of such lawn sprinkler piping, but he shall not make a connection to sanitary or storm sewers. A well-drilling contractor shall, when engaged in the well-drilling business, provide and maintain the necessary equipment in proper and sanitary condition. A prerequisite to the issuance of this certificate shall be the submittal of a current state well driller's license. 
Subcontractor shall mean one who contracts with a contractor to perform a portion of the contractor's work. 
Trade shall include, but shall not be limited to construction, repair, removal of buildings, plumbing work, electrical work, mechanical work, engineering construction work and any similar occupation connected with the construction industry. 
Qualifying agent shall mean any person who has made application; been examined, where required, and approved to qualify as a contractor. He may qualify as a contractor himself, another individual, a firm or a corporation, and in addition to other responsibilities, shall perform all necessary supervision for the contractor. 
(Code 1963, § 5-45; Ord. No. 18-1995, § 2, 6-27-95) 
Cross reference— Definitions and rules of construction generally, § 1-2.  
Sec. 11-127. - Proof of examination passage. 
For the purposes of this article, all of the contractor classifications as defined in section 11-126 shall show proof of passage of H. H. Block examination for their particular classification when applying for a competency card and shall adhere to F.S. ch. 489, if applicable, pertaining to state registration. In addition, they must show proof of two (2) years' experience in their classification prior to issuance of a certificate of competency. 
(Code 1963, § 5-45)  
Sec. 11-128. - Previously licensed contractors. 
(a)  Any person holding a current certificate of competency or certificate of proficiency issued by the board of contractor examiners or the board of electrical examiners or the board of plumbing examiners or the building trades board shall not be required to obtain a new certificate of proficiency or competency as a result of the repeal of the building trades board. 
(b)  Nothing contained in this section shall affect those contractors who currently hold a certificate of competency in a particular classification as previously defined in this chapter of the Code of Ordinances, and such persons shall be authorized to continue to act as contractors within the scope and limitations as previously defined. Provided, however, that the certificate of competency is not revoked or suspended in accordance with this division. 
(c)  Nothing contained in this division shall be construed to exempt a person currently licensed from the requirement of obtaining a certificate of proficiency or competency if such current license is abandoned or a new type of license is sought. 
(d)  The building official shall review the existing licensed contractors as to classification and shall recommend reclassification of contractors in accordance with provisions of this division. 
(Code 1963, § 5-64; Ord. No. 18-1995, § 3, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-129. - Prosecution; penalties. 
(a)  Unless otherwise specifically provided herein, all violations of this article shall be prosecuted through the municipal code enforcement board of the city or a court of competent jurisdiction. 
(b)  Any person who may himself or by his agent or any holder of a certificate of competency or certificate of compliance or certificate of proficiency who fails to comply with the provisions of this article shall be guilty of a violation of this division and upon conviction thereof shall be punished as provided in section 1-15. 
(Code 1963, § 5-62)  
Sec. 11-130. - Prohibited acts and omissions. 
It shall be unlawful for any contractor or any partner, officer, director or qualifying agent of such a contractor to commit any one (1) or more of the following acts or omissions: 
(1)  To do work outside of the scope of work for which the contractor is authorized to perform. 
(2)  Abandon without legal excuse a construction project or operation in which the contractor is engaged or under contract as a contractor. 
(3)  Divert funds or property received for the execution or completion of a specific construction project or operation or for a specific purpose to any other use whatsoever. 
(4)  To depart from or disregard in any material respect the plans or specifications of a construction job without the consent of the owner or his duly authorized representative and the building official, as defined by the Standard Building Code adopted in section 6-101. 
(5)  Disregard or violate any county or municipal ordinance or state law pertaining to the contractor's business or employee or regulating his work or providing safety and health regulations in the construction trades or for construction work. 
(6)  Misrepresent any material fact in an application or supporting papers to obtain a certificate required by this article. 
(7)  Failing to fulfill his contractual obligations, including but not limited to the payment of all creditors for materials furnished or work or services performed. 
(8)  Intentionally evading or violating any of the provisions of this article, which may be evidenced by but not limited to one (1) or more of the following acts: 
a.  Aiding or abetting any person not holding a certificate of competency, to evade or violate any of the provisions of this chapter. 
b.  Allowing a certificate to be used by an unauthorized person. 
c.  Obtaining a permit for any work in which the certificate holder does not actually supervise, direct, and control the construction or installation covered by such permit. 
d.  Subcontracting any work to any person not holding a certificate of competency or certificate of compliance for work involved in the subcontract. 
(9)  Do any fraudulent act as a certificate holder by which another is substantially injured. 
(Code 1963, § 5-63)  
Secs. 11-131—11-140. - Reserved.  
DIVISION 2. - BUILDING OFFICIAL[5] 

Footnotes: 
--- (5) --- 
Editor's note— Ord. No. 18-1995, § 4, adopted June 27, 1995, changed the name of this division from "building trades board" to "building official." 
Cross reference— Provisions regarding the appointment, removal, and resignation requirements, § 2-51 et seq.; travel expenses, § 2-131 et seq. 
 
Sec. 11-141. - Examination of contractors; delegation of authority. 
(a)  There is hereby delegated to the city building official the duty of examining and periodically reviewing contractors, as to their qualifications, including proof of financial responsibility, to engage in the business of contracting in the incorporated areas of the city. 
(b)  Hearings before the building official pursuant to this part shall be held monthly at such time and place as the building official may designate. The building official shall prescribe such rules of procedure and as shall be necessary to carry into execution and operation the powers and duties delegated hereunder. 
(Code 1963, § 5-48; Ord. No. 6-1995, § 1, 3-14-95; Ord. No. 18-1995, § 5, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-142. - Powers and duties of building official. 
(a)  The building official shall have jurisdiction over all matters pertaining to the examination and issuance of certificates of proficiency and of certificates of competency and certificates of compliance and financial responsibility of all contractors who engage in the business of contracting and specialty contracting within the city. 
(b)  The building official shall have the power to determine the qualifications of applicants for the various classes of certificates of competency and certificates of compliance; to hold hearings to determine if a certificate of competency or certificate of compliance or of any contractor, subcontractor, or specialty contractor or specialized contractor should be suspended for violation of a city ordinance and to fix the length of the time for such suspension or to revoke the certificate of competency or certificate of compliance under the provisions of this article, or to request an investigation of any complaints made against the licensed contractor and determine whether administrative action shall be taken against the contractor or specialty contractor or direct the investigator to file a complaint for prosecution for the violation against the contractor or specialty contractor; and to call upon members of the industry for advice and assistance. It shall be the duty of the building official to annually review all related building codes and to make recommendations for any lawful amendments or changes thereto. 
(c)  Testing requirements and experience requirements for all classifications of contractors will be reviewed annually by the building official for recommendations and suggested changes to council. 
(d)  Definitions of contractor, specialty contractor, and specialized contractor categories may only be changed by council action. 
(e)  The building official shall have the authority to review applications for certificates of compliance categories. Applicants denied a certificate of compliance by the building official may appeal within thirty (30) days of the denial by notarized letter to the city council. 
(f)  The building official shall keep a permanent record of those persons applying for certificates of compliance as long as such certificates are renewed biannually in accordance with section 11-178. 
(g)  The building official may, upon his own motion, or upon a sworn complaint, in writing, of any person, investigate the charges against any contractor holding a certificate of competency or certificate of compliance under the provisions of this article or any person who purports to be a contractor. 
(Code 1963, § 5-49; Ord. No. 18-1995, § 6, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-143. - Reserved. 
Editor's note— Ord. No. 18-1995, § 7, adopted June 27, 1995, repealed former § 11-143, which pertained to the executive secretary.  
Secs. 11-144—11-155. - Reserved.  
DIVISION 3. - EXAMINATION[6] 

Footnotes: 
--- (6) --- 
Editor's note— Ord. No. 18-1995, § 8, adopted June 27, 1995, repealed former div. 3, §§ 11-156—11-165, which pertained to enforcement. Section 9 of said ordinance renumbered former div. 4, §§ 11-176—11-182, as div. 3, 11-156—11-161. 
 
Sec. 11-156. - Scope; standard. 
(a)  The building official shall prescribe the type of examination or degree of experience, the knowledge of building, safety, health and lien laws of the city, county, state and federal governments as may be applicable, and the knowledge of rudimentary administrative principles of the contracting business for the attainment of a certificate of competency in the classification of contractor desired. Until changed by the city council, the H.H. Block proctored examination will be the standard as criteria for the issuance of certificates of competency for all contractors except specialty contractors and specialized contractors. 
(b)  In the event an examination is not available through the H.H. Block proctored examination, the building official shall have the authority to prescribe any standard examination which meets equivalent criteria as required in city ordinances and state law for the category indicated. Proof of passage of a proctored examination shall be prerequisite to the issuance of a certificate of proficiency for the tested categories specified in this Code of Ordinances. 
(Code 1963, § 5-51(a); Ord. No. 18-1995, § 9, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-157. - Conduct generally, reciprocity. 
Examinations shall be held at a place, date, and hour to be set by the building official. The examination fees shall be sufficient to cover the costs involved by the building official to administer such examination. As long as the H. H. Block proctored examination is used by the building official as the standard examination, the building official will recognize the passage by any contractor of such examination for the purposes of this article, if such examination is given under the administration of a municipality or county using the H. H. Block examination as the standard criteria. 
(Code 1963, § 5-51(b); Ord. No. 18-1995, § 9, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-158. - Recognition of licenses issued under statute. 
If the applicant is a holder of a current valid certificate of certification from the Florida Construction Industry Licensing Board, as authorized by F.S. ch. 489, the board shall recognize such certificate as meeting the certificate of proficiency and certificate of competency requirements of this Code of Ordinances and no additional examination or requirements shall be imposed; however, the building official may impose the posting of a bond as a condition of issuance of a permit as set forth in section 106.2 of the Standard Building Code. 
(Code 1963, § 5-51(b); Ord. No. 18-1995, § 9, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-159. - Notices. 
(a)  Notice of the next regular examination shall be given by the executive secretary of the building official to all who make application to take such examination. 
(b)  The executive secretary shall notify each applicant in writing whether he has passed the examination and shall automatically issue a certificate of proficiency upon successful passage of such examination. 
(Code 1963, § 5-51(c), (d); Ord. No. 18-1995, § 9, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-160. - Qualification to apply. 
Any individual may apply for a certificate of competency whether he holds a certificate of proficiency or not but the attainment of a certificate of proficiency is a condition precedent to the issuance of a certificate of competency as provided in section 11-178. 
(Code 1963, § 5-51(e); Ord. No. 18-1995, § 9, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-161. - Filing by licensee or holder of certificate of proficiency. 
Each licensee shall keep on file with the city at all times the names and addresses of the persons in the employment of the licensee who hold certificates of proficiency and all projects upon which the licensee is issued a building permit shall be placed under the supervision and control of such a person. The licensee shall notify the city within five (5) days of the termination of the employment of such person by the licensee. 
(Code 1963, § 5-61; Ord. No. 18-1995, § 9, 6-27-95)  
Secs. 11-162—11-175. - Reserved.  
DIVISION 4. - CERTIFICATE OF COMPETENCY AND CERTIFICATE OF COMPLIANCE[7] 

Footnotes: 
--- (7) --- 
Editor's note— Ord. No. 18-1995, § 10, adopted June 27, 1995, renumbered former div. 5 as div. 4. See the Code Comparative Table. 
 
Sec. 11-176. - Certificate of competency—Required. 
(a)  It shall be unlawful for any person to engage in business or to act in the capacity of a contractor or subcontractor under this article within the city without having made application for and been issued a current certificate of competency as required by this article. Proof of issuance of a certificate of competency shall be required prior to issuance of an occupational license when required by section 11-58. 
(b)  All contractors requiring state registration shall possess as a prerequisite to obtaining a certificate of competency a minimum of two (2) years' experience within the classification for which application is made. Contractors in the heading of specialty or specialized contractors shall require one (1) year's experience. 
(c)  The building official may authorize the executive secretary to enter into reciprocal agreements to and issue certificates of competency. The executive secretary shall grant certificates of competency by reciprocity only from those counties and municipalities where the applicant has successfully passed with a grade of seventy-five (75) percent or more, a written examination prepared, graded and proctored by H. H. Block and Associates. Such application shall be accompanied by a financial statement, written affidavit that the applicant will not engage in any work which is not within the scope of the certificate of competency for which the application is made, and will comply with all regulations applicable to the certificate of competency from which application is made. 
(d)  Holders of current certificates of competency may sign building permits to construct work contracted for by a partnership, corporation, business trust or other legally organized association only if the certificate holder is a partner, officer or agent with full-time employment in the partnership, corporation, business trust or other legally organized association. 
(e)  Any person holding a city competency card or compliance certificate or certification at state level may designate one agent to obtain permits for work under the supervision of the qualifier. The agent must be a member or employee of the firm, partnership, or corporation which the card or certificate holder is qualifying and the form of designation must be a notarized letter. The letter may designate an agent for a specified job location and separate authorization letters would be required for any additional permits not in connection with the listed job. The letter may designate an agent for an extended time, not exceeding the biennial competency card or certificate of compliance renewal date of September thirtieth of each odd-numbered year. Letters of authorization of this type will allow the named individual authority to act in the contractor's name for all permits during the time frame specified. Only one (1) person shall be listed on this type of authorization. 
(Code 1963, § 5-46; Ord. No. 18-1995, § 10, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-177. - Same—Application. 
(a)  Any person required or desiring to be qualified as a contractor, shall make application on a form prescribed by the building official. The application shall be retained by the building official together with all supporting papers. The building official shall obtain a written credit report in regard to the application and shall make such additional investigation as may be directed by the building official. Should the applicant be a firm or corporation, the application shall be executed by the president or one legally qualified to act for the firm or corporation and shall show his authority to so act on the application. 
(b)  The application for a certificate of competency shall contain: 
(1)  Name, residence address and phone number, and business address and phone number of applicant. 
(2)  Determination of whether individual, partnership or corporation. If partnership or corporation, names of partners and corporate officers. If the applicant is a corporation, there must be furnished a certified copy of the incorporation and a letter from the secretary of the state that such corporation is in a current status with the secretary of state, including the appointment of a resident agent to receive service of process. 
(3)  A sworn financial statement of the applicant and an agreement authorizing the building official to obtain from any source dealing with the applicant even though confidential, such additional information concerning the applicant's financial condition as the building official deems necessary. A sworn financial statement will not be required of an applicant who has a current certificate of competency with the city for at least three (3) years from the date of the application. An applicant shall be required to disclose any substantial change in his financial statement if a substantial change has occurred. This provision for waiving the financial statement shall control over any section in this chapter to the contrary. 
(4)  A list of all businesses owned, operated or managed by applicant or in which the applicant has had an interest of any kind during the past five (5) years, and the addresses of these businesses. 
(5)  A statement that the applicant has not been convicted of a misdemeanor involving dishonesty, fraud, or moral turpitude or felony during the past five (5) years, and that he is not presently charged with committing a felony or misdemeanor involving dishonesty, fraud or moral turpitude. If this is not the case, applicant shall attach a sheet to the application specifying the details of the conviction or charges. 
(6)  Shall list on the application any schooling or work experience the applicant has had along with dates of such schooling or work experience. 
(7)  Shall state on the application whether or not the applicant has ever declared bankruptcy, or had bankruptcy declared against him and the outcome, if any. 
(8)  Attached to the application shall be the following documents in addition to those required under the previous sections of this article: 
a.  Letter from a licensed insurance agent or agency showing the applicant's insurability for the following policies of insurance: 
1.  Worker's compensation insurance as required by law. 
2.  Public liability insurance in at least the policy limits commonly known as one hundred thousand dollars-three hundred thousand dollars ($100,000.00-$300,000.00), and property damage coverage with limits and liability of fifty thousand dollars ($50,000.00) for all categories requiring an examination. All other categories will require fifty thousand dollars-one hundred thousand dollars ($50,000.00-$100,000.00) liability and twenty thousand dollars ($20,000.00) property damage. 
b.  Certificate of passage of H.H. Block proctored examination for the following classifications: 
General contractor. 
Residential contractor. 
Building contractor. 
Class A, B, C-H.A.R.V. contractors. 
Roofing contractor. 
Sheet metal contractor. 
Commercial swimming pool contractor. 
Residential swimming pool contractor. 
Swimming pool servicing contractor. 
Mechanical contractor. 
Master electrician. 
Master plumber. 
Underground utilities contractor. 
Journeyman electrician. 
Journeyman plumber. 
(Code 1963, § 5-53(A); Ord. No. 18-1995, § 10, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-178. - Same—Issuance, expiration, renewal. 
(a)  The building official shall issue a certificate of competency when it is determined that the applicant is qualified under this division and has met the following requirements: 
(1)  That the financial statement of the applicant and the city's investigation of such financial statement and applicant's credit record show that the applicant is financially able to engage in the contracting business for which the license is requested. 
(2)  That the applicant and each member of the firm and each holder of a certificate of proficiency possesses a reputation for honesty, integrity and has a good character. The lack of honesty, integrity or good character may be established by competent evidence that: 
a.  Applicant or others aforementioned have committed an act within the past five (5) years involving dishonesty, fraud, deceit and lack of integrity whereby the contractor has been benefited or whereby some injury has been sustained by another. 
b.  Applicant or others aforementioned or another firm in which the applicant or others aforementioned were interested has in the past five (5) years refused to pay valid bills of at least three (3) different persons or firms or has been adjudged a bankrupt. 
c.  Applicant or others aforementioned have been convicted of a misdemeanor involving dishonesty, fraud or moral turpitude, or felony during the past five (5) years. 
(3)  That the applicant is insured by a responsible insurance company for the previously stated policy limits in section 11-192(b)(8)a. 
(4)  That the applicant or one (1) of its officers or employees is a holder of a valid certificate of proficiency for the class of license desired. 
a.  A certificate of competency shall expire biennially on September thirtieth. Failure to renew the certificate during September of the renewal year shall cause the certificate to become inoperative, and it is unlawful thereafter for any person to engage, to offer to engage, or hold himself out as engaging in contracting under the certificate unless the certificate is restored or reissued. 
b.  A certificate of competency which is inoperative because of failure to renew shall be restored on payment of the proper renewal fee if the application for restoration is made within ninety (90) days after September thirtieth of the renewal year. If the application for restoration is not made within the ninety-day period, the fee for restoration will be a fifty-dollar penalty in addition to the proper renewal fee; except for journeymen, the fee will be a ten-dollar penalty in addition to the proper renewal fee. The building official shall require reexamination of the applicant if the certificate has lapsed for more than two (2) years. 
c.  A person who holds a valid certificate of competency from the building official may go on an inactive status during which time he shall not engage in contracting, but maintain his certificate on an inactive basis upon payment of the required fee during the inactive period. An inactive certificate of competency which is invalid because of failure to renew shall be restored on payment of the proper renewal fee, if the application for restoration is made within ninety (90) days after September thirtieth of the renewal year. If the application for restoration is not made within the ninety-day period, the fee for restoration will be a fifty-dollar penalty in addition to the proper renewal fee; except for journeymen, the fee will be a ten-dollar penalty in addition to the proper renewal fee. In addition, the building official shall require reexamination of the applicant if the certificate has lapsed more than two (2) years. 
(Code 1963, § 5-54; Ord. No. 18-1995, § 10, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-179. - Certificate of compliance—Required. 
(a)  It shall be unlawful for any person or firm to act in the capacity of a specialized contractor, as defined in section 11-126, within the city, without having made application for, been issued and possessing a current certificate of compliance as required by this article. 
(b)  An employee of a person who holds a current certificate of compliance is not required to possess a certificate of compliance to perform specialized contractor work only if the work is performed under the employer's supervision and if the specific type of work being performed is the type of work for which the employer's certificate of compliance was issued. 
(Code 1963, § 5-46.1; Ord. No. 18-1995, § 10, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-180. - Same—Application. 
Any person required or desiring to be qualified as a specialized contractor shall make application on a form prescribed by the building official. The application shall be retained by the building official together with all supporting papers. Should the applicant be a firm or corporation, the application shall be executed by the president or one legally qualified to act for the firm or corporation and shall show his authority to so act on the application. The application for a certificate of compliance shall contain: 
(1)  Name, residence address and phone number and business name, phone number, and address of the applicant. 
(2)  Determination of whether individual, partnership or corporation. If partnership or corporation, names of partners and corporate officers. If the applicant is a corporation, there must be furnished a certified copy of the incorporation and a letter from the secretary of the state that such corporation is in a current status with the secretary of state, including the appointment of a resident agent to receive service of process. 
(3)  A list of all businesses owned, operated or managed by applicant or in which the applicant has had any interest of any kind during the past five (5) years and the addresses of these businesses. 
(4)  A statement stating that the applicant has not been convicted of a misdemeanor involving dishonesty, fraud, or moral turpitude or felony during the past five (5) years and that he is not presently charged with committing a felony or misdemeanor involving dishonesty, fraud or moral turpitude. If this is not the case, the applicant shall attach a sheet to the application specifying the details of the conviction or charges. 
(5)  Shall list on the application any schooling or work experience applicant has had along with dates of work experience and schooling. The applicant shall demonstrate a minimum of two (2) years' experience in the particular field for which he is applying, with twelve (12) months of such experience in a supervisory position. 
(6)  Shall state on the application whether or not the applicant has ever declared bankruptcy or had bankruptcy declared against him and the outcome, if any. 
(7)  Attached to the application shall be the following documents in addition to those required under the previous sections of this article: 
a.  For all categories of work previously noted in section 11-126, specialized contractors, with the exception of excavating/grading and tree removal/surgeons, a certificate of public liability and property damage insurance in at least the policy limits commonly known as fifty thousand dollars-one hundred thousand dollars ($50,000.00-$100,000.00) liability and twenty thousand dollars ($20,000.00) property damage. 
b.  For the categories of tree removal/surgeons and excavating/grading as indicated under section 11-126, specialized contractors, a certificate of public liability and property damage insurance in at least the policy limits commonly known as one hundred thousand dollars-three hundred thousand dollars ($100,000.00-$300,000.00) liability and fifty thousand dollars ($50,000.00) property damage. 
c.  Worker's compensation insurance certificate when applicable. 
d.  Two (2) notarized letters of work experience from previous customers or employers in the field for which applicant is applying. The letters should state the applicant's expertise and performance in the field for which he is applying. 
(Code 1963, § 5-53(B); Ord. No. 18-1995, § 10, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-181. - Same—Issuance, expiration, renewal. 
(a)  The building official shall authorize the executive secretary to issue a certificate of compliance when it is determined that the applicant is qualified under this article and has met the following requirements: 
(1)  That the applicant and each member of the firm and each holder of a certificate of proficiency possesses a reputation for honesty, integrity and has a good character. The lack of honesty, integrity or good character are as previously noted under section 11-178(a)(2). 
(2)  That the applicant is insured by a responsible insurance company for the previously stated policy limits in section 11-180(7). 
(3)  That the applicant holds the required previous experience for the classification being applied for. 
(b)  The renewal of the certificate of compliance and failure to renew, fees, renewal date, inactive status, etc., shall be as referenced in sections 11-177 and 11-178. 
(Code 1963, § 5-54.1; Ord. No. 18-1995, § 10, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-182. - Business organizations. 
(a)  When an individual proposes to do business in his own name, a certificate of competency or certificate of compliance, when granted, shall be issued only to that individual. 
(b)  If the applicant proposing to engage in contracting is a partnership, corporation, business trust or other legal entity, the application shall state the name of the partnership and of its partners, or the name of the corporation and of its officers and directors, or the name of the business trust and its trustees, or the name of such other legal entity and its members, and furnish evidence of statutory compliance if a fictitious name is used. Such application shall also show that the person applying for the examination is legally qualified to act for the business organization in all matters connected with its contracting business; and that he has authority to supervise construction undertaken by such business organization. The certificate of competency or certificate of compliance, when issued upon application of a business organization, shall be in the name of such business organization and the name of the qualifying individual shall be noted thereon. 
(c)  At least one (1) officer or supervising employee of the business organization shall be qualified under this article in order for the business organization to hold a current certificate of competency or certificate of compliance in the category of business conducted for which the officer or supervising officer or supervising employee is qualified. If any individual so qualified on behalf of such business organization ceases to be affiliated with such business organization, he and the organization shall inform the building official within thirty (30) days from whence the change occurs. In addition, if such individual is the only qualified individual affiliated with the business organization, the business organization shall have a period of sixty (60) days from the termination of the individual's affiliation with the business organization to qualify another person under the provisions of this article, failing which the certificate of the business organization shall be subject to revocation by the building official. During the above-mentioned sixty-day period, no permits shall be issued to such business organization until a qualified individual is approved by the building official for such company. 
(d)  Any contractor issued a certificate of competency or certificate of compliance as herein provided shall place on any and all vehicles utilized by such contractor in his business in the city, his competency card number, or his licensed business name and telephone number, stenciled in one-inch letters in a contrasting color on each side of the vehicle from the back of the driver's side forward. State registered or state certified contractors must display their registration numbers on any and all advertisements/signs per state law. 
(Code 1963, § 5-52; Ord. No. 29-1993, § 1, 9-28-93; Ord. No. 18-1995, § 10, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-183. - Suspension and revocation of certificate. 
The building official may suspend or revoke or refuse to renew a contractor's certificate of competency or certificate of compliance if it is found that the contractor: 
(1)  Fails to maintain at all times with the insurance company, authorized to do business in the state, the limits of insurance required by this division. 
(2)  Contractor and/or licensee or the holder of the certificate of proficiency has committed an act since the issuance of the original certificate of competency or compliance involving dishonesty, fraud, deceit or lack of integrity, whereby the contractor or the holder of the certificate of proficiency has been benefited or whereby some injury has been sustained by another. 
(3)  Contractor and/or licensee or the holder of the certificate of proficiency has since the issuance of the original certificate of competency or compliance refused to pay valid bills of at least three (3) different persons or firms. 
(4)  Contractor and/or licensee or the holder of the certificate of proficiency has since the issuance of the original certificate of competency or compliance been convicted of the commission of a misdemeanor involving dishonesty, fraud or moral turpitude or a felony. 
(5)  That the original license was obtained through nondisclosure, misstatement or misrepresentation of a material fact. 
(6)  That the licensee no longer has an employee or partner in the licensee's business who holds a certificate of proficiency required for the class and type of license held by the licensee. 
(7)  That the licensee has allowed another person to use his license as prohibited by section 11-186. 
(8)  That the licensee has violated any provisions of this chapter or any other ordinance, building code or regulation. 
(9)  Contractor and/or licensee or the holder of the certificate of proficiency has, since the issuance of the original certificate of competency or compliance, within any twelve-month period, refused to correct or satisfy three (3) or more valid complaints from customers relating to the performance of work by the contractor. Alternatively, contractor and/or licensee has failed to remedy or satisfy five (5) or more valid complaints (from customers) during any three-year period. The customer's complaints must be filed with the city to constitute a complaint within the terms of this section. In order to constitute a valid complaint, information or evidence must be produced which would show that the contractor and/or licensee or holder of the certificate of proficiency has failed and refused to honor a contractual provision or failed or refused to honor any warranty or representation relating to work to be performed by a contractor. 
(Code 1963, § 5-55; Ord. No. 18-1995, § 10, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-184. - Procedure for revocation or suspension of certificate of competency and certificate of compliance. 
(a)  The building official, for good cause, may, upon his own motion, or shall upon a sworn complaint in writing of any person, investigate or cause to be investigated, the charges against any person or any holder of a certificate of competency or compliance. Upon the failure of such contractor to keep in force the insurance policy required in this article, the building official take appropriate action, as provided herein. 
(b)  The building official, upon completion of such investigation, shall decide if a prima facie showing of a violation of this article exists, and if so, shall take one (1) or both of the following actions: 
(1)  Send by certified mail a letter to the certificate of competency or certificate of compliance holder or holders at their last known address, as shown by the building official's records, setting out the name of the complainant, the alleged offense and the approximate time of the commission, and the section of this article alleged to be violated, and notifying them to appear before the building official at a time and place fixed, not sooner than twenty (20) days from the mailing of the certified letter, advising that they may be represented by an attorney, and that they should bring with them all original documents and other data that may be pertinent to the case and that they will be given the opportunity to present such witnesses and evidence as they deem appropriate. 
(2)  Refer the matter to the state attorney's office for appropriate action. 
(c)  The administrative hearing provided for above shall be open to the public. 
(d)  The proceedings at the hearing shall be recorded and may be transcribed at the expense of the party requesting the transcript. 
(e)  The hearing need not be conducted according to technical rules relating to evidence and witnesses. Any relevant evidence shall be admitted if the building official finds it competent and reliable, regardless of the existence of any common law or statutory rule which might make improper the admission of such evidence. Hearsay evidence may be used for the purpose of supplementing or explaining any direct evidence, but shall not be sufficient in itself to support a finding unless it would be admissible in civil actions. The rules of privilege shall be effective to the same extent that they are now or hereafter may be recognized in civil actions. Irrelevant and unduly repetitious evidence shall be excluded. 
(f)  Each party shall have the following rights: To call and examine witnesses; to introduce exhibits; to cross-examine opposing witnesses on any matter relevant to the issues even though that matter was not covered in the direct examination; to impeach any witnesses regardless of which party first called him to testify; and to rebut the evidence against him. The procedure to be utilized shall be substantially in accordance with F.S. ch. 120. 
(g)  A decision shall be made within five (5) days after the close of the hearing. The decision shall be one (1) of the following: 
(1)  Not guilty. 
(2)  Suspension of the certificate of competency, stating time. 
(3)  Revocation of the certificate, naming the effective date. 
(4)  Official letter of reprimand to become a part of the certificate holder's permanent record. 
(h)  The building official may, at its discretion, assess all, or any part, of the direct costs of the administrative hearing upon any contractor found guilty of a violation of this chapter. The assessment, if any, will be required to be paid prior to any reinstatement of the certificate of competency or certificate of compliance. Costs of the hearing shall be as determined by the city finance department from direct billing and man-hours expended. 
(Code 1963, § 5-56; Ord. No. 18-1995, § 10, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-185. - Appeals. 
Any applicant for a certificate of competency or certificate of compliance that is denied a certificate by the building official may appeal to the city council and any contractor that has had his certificate of competency or certificate of compliance suspended, revoked or reprimanded by the building official may appeal to the city council. Any such appeal must be taken within twenty (20) days of denial, suspension, revocation or reprimand, or otherwise shall be barred. 
(Code 1963, § 5-57; Ord. No. 18-1995, § 10, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-186. - Use of contractor's name by another. 
No contractor shall allow his name to be used by any person, directly or indirectly, for the purpose of obtaining a permit or for the purpose of doing any work under his occupational license or certificate of competency or certificate of compliance. Violation of this section shall be grounds for the suspension or revocation of a certificate of competency, certificate of compliance and an occupational license. 
(Code 1963, § 5-58; Ord. No. 18-1995, § 10, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-187. - Credit report fees. 
In addition to the occupational license fee required in section 11-58 and the examination fee, the building official may establish a fee schedule to cover the cost of obtaining the credit reports outlined in this article. 
(Code 1963, § 5-60; Ord. No. 18-1995, § 10, 6-27-95)  
Secs. 11-188—11-200. - Reserved.  
DIVISION 5. - ENFORCEMENT OF UNLICENSED CONTRACTOR ACTIVITIES 
 
Sec. 11-201. - Definitions. 
(a)  Advertise shall mean to tell about, communicate, inform, advise, in or through any public or private manner or form, including, but not limited to, through newspaper(s), handbill(s) or flyer(s), business card(s), magazine(s), telephone directory(ies), radio, television, telephone solicitation, and/or conversation. 
(b)  Board shall mean the City of Titusville Municipal Code Enforcement Board, as established by the City of Titusville Code of Ordinances. 
(c)  Certificate means a certificate of competency issued by the state department of processional regulation or the building official of the city. 
(d)  Certification means the act of obtaining or holding a certificate of competency from the state department of profession regulation or the building official of the city. 
(e)  Certified contractor means any contractor who possesses a certificate of competency issued by the board or the state department of professional regulation or the building official of the city. 
(f)  Code enforcement officer shall mean a person as defined in F.S. ch. 162, and authorized by the city to enforce this division. 
(g)  Contractor shall mean and refer to any person who undertakes to, or submits a bid to, or does himself or herself or by others, construct, repair, alter, remodel, add to, subtract from, demolish, move, or improve any building or structure, including related improvements to real estate, for others, or for resale to others, or who undertakes or offers to undertake or purports to have the capacity to undertake, or submits a bid to, or does himself or herself, or by or through others, engages in a trade or occupation regulated by this division, Code of Ordinances section 11-126 et seq., or F.S. ch. 489. 
(h)  Licensed means possessing the certificates required pursuant to F.S. ch. 489, parts I and II, and/or city Code of Ordinances (and the successor statutes and ordinances to the above as they may be amended from time to time). It may also mean not having an appropriate occupational license. 
(i)  Qualifying agent means a person as defined in F.S. § 489.105(4), (5), and section 11-126 of the Code of Ordinances (and as may be amended from time to time). 
(j)  Registered contractor means any contractor who has registered with the state department of professional regulation pursuant to fulfilling the competency requirements of the building official. 
(k)  Repeat violation shall mean a recurring violation of a provision of this division by a violator whom the municipal code enforcement board has previously found to have violated the same provision, or a violator against whom penalties were assessed for the same provision, within five (5) years prior to the violation. 
(l)  Serve shall mean providing to the alleged violator by certified mail, return receipt requested; by hand delivery by the police department, or other law enforcement officer or code enforcement officer; or by leaving the notice at the alleged violator's usual place of residence with any person residing therein above fifteen (15) years of age and informing such person of the contents of the notice; or by including the hearing date on the citation. In addition, "serve" may also include service by publication or posting as follows: 
(1)  a. 
Such notice shall be published once during each week for four (4) consecutive weeks (four (4) publications being sufficient) in a newspaper of general circulation in the county where the code enforcement board is located. The newspaper shall meet such requirements as are prescribed under F.S. ch. 50, for legal and official advertisements. 
b.  Proof of publication shall be made as provided in chapter 50, sections 50-41 and 50-51. 
(2)  a. 
In lieu of publication as described in paragraph (1), such notice may be posted for at least ten (10) days in at least two (2) locations, one of which shall be the property upon which the violation is alleged to exist and the other of which shall be City Hall; 
b.  Proof of posting shall be by affidavit of the person posting the notice, which affidavit shall include a copy of the notice posted and the date and places of its posting. 
(3)  Notice of publication or posting may run concurrently with, or may follow, an attempt or attempts to provide notice by hand delivery or by mail as required under subsection (l). 
(Ord. No. 18-1995, § 11, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-202. - Enforcement authority delegated to code enforcement board. 
The municipal code enforcement board, herein referred to as "the board," is delegated the authority to enforce the provisions of this division as it relates to individuals acting in the capacity of contractors who are unlicensed or inadequately licensed to perform the classification of work in which they are engaged in the city. 
(Ord. No. 18-1995, § 11, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-203. - Powers of the code enforcement board. 
In addition to all other powers which the board currently has through the provisions of F.S. ch. 162, local ordinance, or otherwise, with regard to enforcement of this division the board shall have the power to: 
(1)  Adopt rules for the conduct of its hearings. 
(2)  Subpoena evidence, alleged violators and witnesses to its hearings. (Subpoenas may be served by the police department or any other duly authorized person). 
(3)  Take testimony under oath. 
(4)  Issue orders having the force of law to command whatever steps are necessary to bring a violator into compliance. 
(5)  Give notices of hearings and conduct hearings on charges of a violation of the provisions of this division. 
(6)  Impose disciplinary penalties against persons found by the board to have violated any provision of this division. 
(Ord. No. 18-1995, § 11, 6-27-95)  
Sec. 11-204. - Violations. 
(a)  Any person cited for a violation of the provisions of this division is deemed to be charged with a noncriminal infraction. 
(b)  It shall be a violation of this division for any person, individual, partnership, corporation, firm, association, or other entity to: 
(1)  Falsely hold himself or a business organization out as a licensee, certificate holder, or registrant;
